Conditional Rendering and Loops

Conditional Rendering

The conditional rendering attributes render-if , render-elif , and render-else are used to control whether a piece of code or a component should be rendered based on certain conditions.

For example: 

<div render-if="condition1">...</div>
<div render-elif="condition2">...</div>
<div render-else>...</div>

  • render-if : Renders the element if the condition specified evaluates to true.

  • render-elif : Used when you have more than one condition. It will render the element if the previous conditions are false and the current condition is true.

  • render-else : Used at the end of a series of render-if and render-elif conditions. It renders the element if all the previous conditions are false.

Loops

The for-each attribute is used to loop over a list of items. It's equivalent to the for..in loop in other languages. 

<ul>
    <li for-each="item in items">
        {{item}}
    </li>
</ul>

This attribute is used to iterate over an array of items or anything else that's iterable in Python, like a string. It renders the HTML element it is attached to for each item in the array.
